titles.title: Honoring the Department of Justice on the occasion of its 140th anniversary.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Mr. Cohen moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 1422.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 416 - 3 (Roll no. 366).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

term.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

bill.summary: 6/16/2010--Passed House without amendment. Honors the Department of Justice (DOJ) on its 140th anniversary and commends the work of its employees in pursuing justice, combating crime, ensuring civil liberties, and protecting the people of the United States.
